intro: Phytocrene forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' phytocrene, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Phytocrene forbesii is considered a species of conservation concern.
